taxon_name.authority: (Tuckerman) Mackenzie in N. L. Britton et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family cyperaceae;genus carex;section filifoliae;species filifolia;variety filifolia

bio:treatment.description: Culms round to sharply trigonous, 8–35 cm. Leaf blades 7–25 cm, 0.3–0.7 mm wide near base. Spike (10–)12–26(–30) × 3–7 mm, staminate portion 4–14 mm. Longest pistillate scales 2.9–4.5(–6.5) × 1.9–4 mm excluding awns, usually equaling or longer than perigynia. Perigynia obovate, (2.8–)3–4.8 × 1.4–2 mm; beak 0.2–0.8 mm. Achenes 2.2–3(–3.3) × 1.3–1.9 mm.
Dry to dryish areas, stable silt-loam or gravel, on slopes, headlands, eroded areas, swales;
Alta., B.C., Man., N.W.T., Sask., Yukon; Alaska, Ariz., Calif., Colo., Idaho, Kans., Minn., Mont., Nebr., Nev., N.Mex., N.Dak., Oreg., S.Dak., Utah, Wash., Wyo.
